intro: Pedicularis schistostegia, commonly known as the rock beard orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which includes approximately 200 species of flowering plants, many of which are found in alpine and subalpine habitats. The plant is characterized by its reddish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, and its hairy, often glandular stems and leaves. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in open, sunny areas at high altitudes. The species is notable for its unique floral structure and its role in the ecological dynamics of its native environment.
